intro: Larentia mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican larentia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and knotweed. The plant features upright, slender stems covered in soft, hairy foliage. Its small, clustered flowers are typically greenish-white with a subtle pinkish tinge. Larentia mexicana is often found in rocky or well-drained soils and is adapted to temperate to subtropical climates.
